title: Ateş Kuşları
overview: Most street children do not reach the age of twenty. It cannot be said that those who saw it lived. Drugs, violence, sexual harassment, hunger... The fate of street children is either prison or grave. Five of these children manage to resist this fate. Calling themselves "Rootless"; The Firebirds, the oldest of which is 13, the youngest is 6 years old, one girl and one autistic, five street children who find a forty-day-old baby in a garbage dump and tell how they turned from "Rootless" to "Firebirds"; will cover the stories of children resisting hardship, pain and fate against all odds.
